intro: Acinos sido, commonly known as the Sierra foothill dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer. Acinos sido is an important plant for pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its native range.
